meanings.definition: To take back or withdraw a statement or belief.
meanings.sent1: She recants her claim about seeing a ghost last night.
meanings.sent2: He always recants his promises when things get tough.
meanings.sent3: The cat recants its decision to chase the mouse and walks away.
meanings.sent4: The politician recants his support for the new law after public backlash.
meanings.sent5: The student recants his answer after realizing it was incorrect.

meanings.definition: The act of retracting a previous statement or belief.
meanings.sent1: Her recants of the conspiracy theory surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The recants of his confession raised doubts about his guilt.
meanings.sent3: The recants of the weather forecast made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The recants of the witness added a new twist to the case.
meanings.sent5: The recants of the scientist shook the foundation of the theory.
